intro: Waltheria arenicola, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Waltheria arenicola is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
